intro: Sinadoxa, commonly known as the "Mexican bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Mexico and Central America. The plants typically have showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. They are often found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Sinadoxa species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their unique floral display.
